caption_text: The reactor design used for the photocatalytic eva- luation of the commercial powders and the powders made in this study is shown in Fig. 2. It is the Supermix photochemical reactor (Ace Glass Inc.) and consists of a Pyrex glass reaction vessel with working volume 600 cm3. The performance of such photoreactors has been extensively studied in the past (Yue, 1985, 1993; Tymoschuk ci at, 1993).

caption_text: These values are obtained from the slopes of the best- fit lines passing through the data in Fig. 8. Comparison of the photodestruction rates from Fig. 8 and the normalized kap values summarized in Table 2 shows that the photoactivity of the powders is related to their specific surface area and their phase composition. The kap values obtained in the present study compare reasonably well with those reported by Al-Ekabi and Serpone (1988), Sclafani et at (1990) and Wei and Wan (1991).
raw_window: These values are obtained from the slopes of the best- fit lines passing through the data in Fig. 8.

Comparison of the photodestruction rates from Fig. 8 and the normalized kap values summarized in Table 2 shows that the photoactivity of the powders is related to their specific surface area and their phase composition.
The kap values obtained in the present study compare reasonably well with those reported by Al-Ekabi and Serpone (1988), Sclafani et at (1990) and Wei and Wan (1991).

caption_text: Comparison of the photodestruction rates from Fig. 8 and the normalized kap values summarized in Table 2 shows that the photoactivity of the powders is related to their specific surface area and their phase composition.
raw_window: Comparison of the photodestruction rates from Fig. 8 and the normalized kap values summarized in Table 2 shows that the photoactivity of the powders is related to their specific surface area and their phase composition.
The kap values obtained in the present study compare reasonably well with those reported by Al-Ekabi and Serpone (1988), Sclafani et at (1990) and Wei and Wan (1991).
They are, however, lower compared to the kap values obtained by Okamoto et at (1985a).
